snippet: The National Security Agency has lobbied to deploy a “Star Wars” defense for America’s computer networks, but officials said the plan had little chance of moving forward.
abstract: National Security Agency is lobbying inside the government to deploy equivalent of 'Star Wars' defense for America’s computer networks, designed to intercept cyberattacks before they can cripple power plants, banks or financial markets; administration officials say however that plan, championed by Gen Keith B Alexander, has virtually no chance of moving forward given backlash against NSA over recent disclosures about its surveillance programs.
lead_paragraph: The National Security Agency has lobbied to deploy a “Star Wars” defense for America’s computer networks, but officials said the plan had little chance of moving forward.

headline.main: N.S.A. Leaks Make Plan for Cyberdefense Unlikely
headline.print_headline: N.S.A. Leaks Make Plan For Cyberdefense Unlikely
